newsitem.title: CANADA: Thomson Corp names Michael Brown successor.
newsitem.headline: Thomson Corp names Michael Brown successor.

text.p: Thomson Corp said on Monday it named Richard Harrington chief operating officer of the company and that Harrington will succeed Michael Brown as president and chief executive officer on January 1, 1998.
On January 1, 1998, Brown will replace John Tory as deputy chairman.
Harrington joined Thomson in 1982. Most recently, he was chief executive of Thomson Newspapers and a director and executive vice-president of Thomson.
The company said Harrington reorganized Thomson's newspapers into strategic marketing groups, selling those which did not fit the strategy and buying those that did.
Brown has been president of Thomson since 1985.

"His contribution has been truly outstanding, and I am delighted that the corporation will continue to benefit from his experience and enthusiasm when he assumes his new role in 1998," Chairman Ken Thomson said in a statement.
